H0.text: 4 m/s² is the acceleration of a 5‑kg object at rest when a 20‑N force acts on it on a frictionless surface.

H1.text: 15 m/s² is the acceleration of the 5‑kg object when a 20‑N force acts on it at rest on a frictionless surface.

H2.text: 25 m/s² is the acceleration of a 5‑kg object at rest that is acted on by a 20‑N force on a frictionless surface.

H3.text: 100 m/s² is the acceleration of a 5‑kg object at rest when a 20‑N force acts on it on a frictionless surface.

A4.text: Then force equals the product of the mass and the time derivative of the velocity, which is the acceleration: F = m a.

A5.text: The change of motion of an object is proportional to the force impressed; and is made in the direction of the straight line in which the force is impressed.
